channel.title: What's Happening?
channel.description:

item.title: What's Happening?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“ghostly150, post:3, topic:332164”]LOL! It was right in front of my face!!! I am such an Idiot, lol I forgot to close a string… lol I’m such a noob! sorry to waste your time[/quote]No problem. It usually is silly mistakes.

Read full topic

item.title: What's Happening?
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

This is what I was adding:

public void q1help() { sendQuest("Black Knight's Fortress", 8144); clearQuestInterface(); if(q1 == 0){ sendQuest("@blu@I can start this quest by speaking to @red@Sir Amik Varze @blu@at the", 8147); sendQuest("@red@White Knight's Castle @blu@in @red@Falador@blu@.", 8148); sendQuest("@red@I must have a total of 13 Quest Points", 8149); sendQuest("@blu@I would have an advantage if I could fight @red@Level 33 Knights", 8150); sendQuest("@blu@and if I had a smithing level of @red@26@blu@. } if(q1 == 1){ sendQuest("", 8147); sendQuest("", 8148); sendQuest("", 8149); sendQuest("", 8150); } if(q1 == 2){ sendQuest("", 8147); sendQuest("", 8148); sendQuest("", 8149); sendQuest("", 8150); } if(q1 == 3){ sendQuest("", 8147); sendQuest("", 8148); sendQuest("", 8149); sendQuest("", 8150); } if(q1 == 15){ sendQuest("", 8147); sendQuest("", 8148); sendQuest("", 8149); sendQuest("", 8150); } sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }
It used to work before but now it’s not… If anyone could help me look through the code, it would go faster and I would really appreciate it. Thank You.

LATER…

LOL! It was right in front of my face!!! I am such an Idiot, lol I forgot to close a string… lol I’m such a noob! sorry to waste your time

Read full topic

item.title: What's Happening?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

You need to know that coding in java isn’t just copy & paste. You have to abide by strict formatting, meaning that if you misplace the smallest thing such as a bracket or semi-colon, your compiler will read everything after it as an error, resulting in 100 errors. Try as best as you can to undo what you’ve done.

Read full topic
